question: What is the authenticity of practices e.g Qul when somebody dies?

QUESTION
In subcontinent culture when somebody dies then all family members and friends are invited by dead persons spouse. A meal is served,Quran is read and it is believed that the sawab will go to the spirit of the dead person. I feel that sometimes this is a very costly exercise for the family of dead person but they do it as it is a well established practice. Kindly explain whether it is part of Islamic tradition or not, Halal/Haram.
